There's just so much to choose from, but this is my favorite:
 
 "Our enemies are innovative and resourceful, and so are we. They never stop thinking about new ways to harm our country and our people, and neither do we." -George W. Bush, Washington, D.C., Aug. 5, 2004

post_info.post_title: What's the dumbest thing W ever said

Soooo many to choose from. I like "My pan(not misspelled) plays down an unprecedented amount of our national debt."-Budget address to Congress, Feb. 27, 2001 , or "This administration is doing everything we can to end the stalemate in an efficient way. We're making the right decisions to bring the solution to an end."-Washington, D.C., April 10, 2001 
 
 Dono
"Bill Clinton is a wonderful family man."

Go here for it all:
 http://www.dubyaspeak.com/
 
 One of my favorites:

 Eh, here's a few more gems:
 "One of my hardest parts of my job is to console the family members who have lost their life."
 
 "I'm honored to shake the hand of a brave Iraqi citizen who had his hand cut off by Saddam Hussein."
 
 "When you have your own money, it means you've got more money to spend."
 
 "The benefits of helping somebody is beneficial."
 
 "We're in for a long struggle, and I think Texans understand that. And so do Americans."
 
 "Sometimes when I sleep at night I think of "Hop on Pop"."
 
 "I promise you I will listen to what has been said here, even though I wasn't here."
 
 "And one of the things we've got to make sure that we do is anything."
 
 "We're making the right decisions to bring the solution to an end."
 
 "Border relations between Canada and Mexico have never been better."
 
 " I've been to war. I've raised twins. If I had a choice, I'd rather go to war. "
 (Sorry to inform you, but you've never been to war.)

 "You teach a child to read and he or her will be able to pass a literacy test."
 
 "No, I know all the war rhetoric, but it's all aimed at achieving peace."
 
 "My mom often used to say, "The trouble with W" -- although she didn't put that to words."
 
 "I know what I believe. I will continue to articulate what I believe and what I believe -- I believe what I believe is right."
 
 "Africa is a nation that suffers from incredible disease."
 
 "I understand small business growth. I was one."
 
 "Families is where our nation finds hope, where wings take dream."
"I believe fish and man can coexist"

New favorite:
 "I can't think of a mistake I've made."

"hey dad, would you help me run for office?"
 
 then again, to think of the alternative to him getting elected....

The United States office of the President sure did an about-face. We went from Bill Clinton, an intelligent, master of the english( Americanese anyway) language, to W, a bumbling idiot with a speech impediment, i.e., a gift for slurring words and mumbling. 
 Listen to any speech by Mr Clinton, then listen to W, the difference is day and night; any one that can follow Bush or believes anything he says is probably a mindless robot of the republican neo-(nazi) conservative party.
 I want to regurgitate whenever I hear Mr. Bush mumble through a speech, My poor country, my poor country, we are the laughing stock of the world.
 
 This, BTW, is a statement by a long-time Republican Hawk, that voted for Bush. I am so sorry, I apologize, I am almost in tears here.
The only man to pronounce spelling mistakes

Actually his horrible public speaking skills are the only thing that make me empathize with the man. I can't do public speaking either - I blush , stutter and forget what I am supposed to be saying.

Outside my political economy tute room, there is pinned up on the noticeboard a piece of paper written "The problem with the French is that they have no word for entrepeneur" - attributed to George W Bush.

I can't do public speaking either - I blush , stutter and forget what I am supposed to be saying.

 That is not unusual. If you want to improve your speaking skills, I recommend TOASTMASTERS. There are clubs nationwide devoted to improving public speaking skills. Give it a shot, you will enjoy it and you will get better with the spoken word.
